qas.question: What major movement occurred in Guam in the 80's and 90's?
Why would Guam becoming a commonwealth be so important?

answers.text: would give it a level of self-government similar to Puerto Rico

qas.question: What is the name of this U.S state that could possibly form a union with Guam?
In what decade was union between Hawaii and Guam first brought up?
In what decade did union between Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands first start to get talked about?
In what decade was the U.S. Constitution last modified?
When did people in Guam start advocating for U.S. statehood?

context: In the <b4_0><b6_0>1980s<b6_0/><b4_0/> and early <b3_0><b5_0>1990s<b5_0/><b3_0/>, there was a significant movement in favor of the territory <a0_0>becoming a commonwealth<a0_0/>, which <a1_0>would give it a level of self-government similar to Puerto Rico<a1_0/> and the Northern Mariana Islands. However, the federal government rejected the version of a commonwealth that the government of Guam proposed, due to it having clauses incompatible with the Territorial Clause (Art. IV, Sec. 3, cl. 2) of the U.S. Constitution. Other movements advocate U.S. statehood for Guam, union with the state of <a2_0>Hawaii<a2_0/>, union with the Northern Mariana Islands as a single territory, or independence.
